title: Add SEC EDGAR as optional fundamentals source (US stocks)
description: Add an optional SEC EDGAR fundamentals backend for US stocks to improve accuracy/traceability of key fundamentals (authoritative filings/XBRL). Keep existing FMP/Finnhub implementation as the default to avoid breaking current behavior.
design:
- Add env var `FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER` with allowed values: `fmp` (default), `sec`.
- Default behavior MUST remain unchanged: if `FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER` is unset, continue current fundamentals fetching (FMP + optional Finnhub enrichment).
- Implement SEC backend in isolated module (e.g., `src/data_fetchers/fundamentals_sec.py`) that fetches:
  - ticker->CIK mapping
  - companyfacts JSON (XBRL) for a minimal set of metrics
- Respect SEC access rules: include a descriptive User-Agent (configurable via env var), add caching, and avoid excessive requests.
- Map SEC facts into your existing `fundamentals_summary` keys where feasible (company name, shares/market cap not always available; start with revenue, net income, assets, liabilities, shares if present).
acceptance_criteria:
- With `FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER=sec`, `tool_get_fundamentals('AAPL')` returns a payload that `fundamentals_summary` can consume (no exceptions) and includes at least a few SEC-derived metrics.
- With `FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER` unset, current fundamentals behavior remains identical.
- SEC calls use a configurable User-Agent and are cached to avoid repeated downloads.
- Unit tests cover ticker->CIK mapping and parsing of a minimal companyfacts payload using fixtures/mocks.
- Docs update: `.env.example` and README mention `FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER` and required env vars.

title: Implement Stooq CSV fetch + parsing module
description: Create the Stooq EOD price backend module and parsing logic.
acceptance_criteria:
- New module added (e.g., `src/data_fetchers/prices_stooq.py`) that fetches Stooq daily CSV and returns DataFrame with expected columns.
- Robust handling for empty/invalid responses.
- No network calls in unit tests (mock requests).
notes:
Implemented Stooq EOD backend module and unit tests.

Changes:
- Added `src/data_fetchers/prices_stooq.py` with `fetch_price_history_stooq(symbol)` (CSV parsing + empty/HTML handling)
- Added `tests/test_prices_stooq.py` using mocked `requests.get`

Validation:
- `pytest -q` (6 passed)

Notes:
- This task does not change existing routing/default behavior; wiring via `PRICE_PROVIDER` is in sa-brx.
close_reason: Added Stooq EOD price fetcher module + mocked unit tests; validated with pytest and pushed.

title: Testing
description: Add/extend automated tests to cover critical paths (fetchers, analysis, routing) and keep pytest green.
acceptance_criteria:
- Add at least one meaningful test for an untested module.
- Tests use mocks/fixtures (no network).
- `pytest -q` passes.

title: Stock comparison view (side-by-side)
description: Add ability to compare 2-4 stocks side-by-side with synchronized charts and metric comparison tables. Show relative performance, valuation differences, and correlation analysis.
design: New comparison mode: Multi-select stocks, display metrics in comparison table format. Overlay charts with different colors. Highlight significant differences (green/red badges).

title: Sector and industry peer comparison
description: Show how the analyzed stock compares to its sector and industry peers. Display sector average P/E, returns, volatility. Add visual indicators showing if stock is outperforming or underperforming peers.
design: Add 'Peer Comparison' section in Fundamental tab. Fetch sector averages, display comparison bars. Use color coding to show relative performance vs peers.

title: Add stock watchlist with multi-stock comparison
description: Allow users to create a watchlist of multiple stocks and view side-by-side comparison of key metrics (returns, P/E, RSI). Add ability to save watchlist to session state and compare performance across stocks.
design: Sidebar: Add watchlist widget to add/remove stocks. New tab: 'Portfolio Comparison' showing table with all watchlist stocks and their key metrics. Visual indicators for best/worst performers.

title: Add FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER routing + docs for SEC EDGAR
description: Wire SEC provider selection into fundamentals fetcher tooling and document usage.
acceptance_criteria:
- `FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER` and SEC User-Agent env vars added to config.
- Routing added without changing default (FMP) behavior.
- `.env.example` and README updated with required SEC User-Agent guidance.
- Tests cover routing behavior and non-breaking defaults.
notes:
Likely files:
- src/utils/config.py (add FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER + SEC_USER_AGENT)
- src/data_fetchers/fundamentals.py or src/agent/tools.py (route to SEC backend)
- src/data_fetchers/fundamentals_sec.py (new)
- .env.example + README.md

Non-breaking requirement:
- If FUNDAMENTALS_PROVIDER is unset, existing FMP/Finnhub behavior must remain unchanged.

SEC constraints:
- Must send a descriptive User-Agent string.
- Must cache requests (avoid repeated downloads).

title: Add error handling for API rate limits
description: Implement retry logic with exponential backoff for API calls in data_fetchers. Handle rate limit errors gracefully with user-friendly messages.

title: News sentiment analysis with scoring
description: Enhance news tab with sentiment analysis (positive/neutral/negative) for each news item. Show aggregate sentiment score and trend over time. Use simple keyword-based or LLM-based sentiment analysis.
design: Add sentiment badge to each news item. Show sentiment trend chart. Aggregate sentiment score as metric. Use TextBlob or call LLM for sentiment classification.

title: Export analysis to PDF report
description: Add 'Export to PDF' button that generates a professional PDF report with all analysis tabs, charts, and LLM insights. Include company logo, timestamp, and disclaimer. Users can save or email the report.
design: Add button in Overview section. Use reportlab or weasyprint to generate PDF. Include: header with stock info, all tabs as sections, embedded charts, formatted tables.
acceptance_criteria:
- In the Streamlit app, an “Export to PDF” action is available in the Overview section for a completed analysis.
- Clicking export generates a PDF that includes: (1) header with ticker/company name and run timestamp, (2) a disclaimer section, (3) the LLM summary/insights text, (4) key tables (e.g., fundamentals/technicals outputs), and (5) at least one representative chart image embedded.
- The exported PDF is downloadable from the UI (Streamlit download button) and has a deterministic filename format like `<TICKER>_analysis_<YYYYMMDD_HHMM>.pdf`.
- Export succeeds without network access (no external calls required during export) and handles missing optional sections gracefully (e.g., if no news, the news section is omitted or marked “No data”).
- Errors during export are caught and surfaced to the user as a friendly message (no raw stack traces in the UI).
- Basic automated coverage exists for the PDF generation function (e.g., unit test asserts a non-empty PDF bytes output and presence of expected header text).
notes:
Implementation completed.

Validation:
- `pytest -q` (3 passed)

Notes:
- Export uses ReportLab; embedded price chart is rendered via Matplotlib (Agg) when price history is present.
- Streamlit Overview now provides a single Download button that returns a PDF (no network calls during export).
close_reason: Implemented PDF export end-to-end (Streamlit UI + ReportLab generator + unit test), validated with `pytest -q`, and pushed to origin.

title: Save and retrieve past analyses
description: Allow users to save analysis snapshots with timestamp. Store in local JSON files or session state. Add 'History' view to compare current analysis vs past analyses for the same stock.
design: Add 'Save Analysis' button. Store analysis data with timestamp. New 'History' tab showing timeline of saved analyses. Compare key metrics over time.

title: Interactive chart with zoom and annotations
description: Replace static Streamlit charts with interactive Plotly charts. Add zoom, pan, hover tooltips, trend line annotations. Allow users to draw support/resistance lines.
design: Use plotly.graph_objects for charts. Add buttons for zoom reset, timeframe selection. Hover shows OHLC data. Drawing tools for technical analysis annotations.

title: Implement caching for API responses
description: Add caching layer using src/storage/cache.py to reduce API calls to Alpha Vantage, Finnhub, and FMP. Respect rate limits and TTL per provider.

title: Improve Recent News: tabular summary (Date/Source/Link)
description:
The app's "Recent News" section should show a compact table summary instead of a detailed view.

Goal:
- Replace the current detailed rendering in the "Recent News" section with a table that summarizes items.

Scope:
- UI-only change in the Recent News section.
- Keep existing news fetching/storage behavior unchanged.

Non-goals:
- No new filtering, search, pagination, or additional widgets.
- No redesign of other sections.

Likely files:
- src/app/streamlit_app.py (Recent News rendering)
- src/data_fetchers/news.py (only if needed to expose/normalize fields like source/url/date)
acceptance_criteria:
- Recent News displays a table with exactly these columns (in this order): Date, Source, Link.
- Date is human-readable and consistently formatted (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD or locale date), derived from the news item publish time.
- Source shows the publisher/source name (fallback to a reasonable default if missing).
- Link is clickable and opens the news article URL.
- The section no longer renders per-item long-form/detailed text by default.
- Existing data fetch behavior remains unchanged; only presentation changes unless fields are missing.

Validation:
- Run `streamlit run src/app/streamlit_app.py` and verify the Recent News section renders a table with clickable links.
- (Optional) Run `pytest -q` to ensure no regressions.
notes:
Updated Recent News table rendering in src/app/streamlit_app.py per updated request:
- Added Summary column (1–2 lines via truncation ~220 chars).
- Link now displays the article headline/title as clickable text (not the raw URL).
- Implemented as a simple HTML table rendered with st.markdown(..., unsafe_allow_html=True) to ensure link anchor text is respected.

Validation:
- python -m py_compile src/app/streamlit_app.py
- python -m pytest -q (2 passed)
close_reason: Completed: Recent News now shows Date/Source/Summary and the Link column uses the article title as clickable text. Validated with py_compile and pytest; changes pushed to origin.

title: Add support for multiple timeframes
description: Allow users to select different timeframes (1M, 3M, 6M, 1Y, 5Y) for technical analysis and charting in the Streamlit UI.

title: Risk score dashboard with visual indicators
description: Create aggregate risk score (0-100) based on volatility, beta, drawdown, RSI, trend. Display as gauge chart with color zones (green=low risk, yellow=medium, red=high). Break down contributing factors.
design: Add Risk Score card in Overview section. Use plotly gauge chart. Expandable details showing how each factor contributes to overall risk score.

title: Quick action recommendations (Buy/Hold/Sell)
description: Add prominent, actionable recommendation in Overview section with clear Buy/Hold/Sell signal based on combined technical and fundamental analysis. Include confidence level and key reasons.
design: Large badge/card in Overview with Buy/Hold/Sell + confidence %. Color-coded (green/yellow/red). 2-3 bullet points explaining reasoning. Disclaimer about not being financial advice.
close_reason: Completed: Added prominent Buy/Hold/Sell recommendation in Overview section with confidence score and key factors. Implements scoring algorithm based on trend, RSI, MACD, returns, price position, and valuation. Color-coded display (green=BUY, orange=HOLD, red=SELL) with emoji indicators and disclaimer.

title: Add PRICE_PROVIDER routing + docs for Stooq
description: Wire provider selection into existing `fetch_price_history` and document it.
acceptance_criteria:
- `PRICE_PROVIDER` env var added to config.
- Routing added in `src/data_fetchers/prices.py` without changing existing default path.
- `.env.example` and README updated.
- Minimal unit tests cover routing behavior.
notes:
Implemented PRICE_PROVIDER routing for Stooq without changing default behavior.

Changes:
- Added `PRICE_PROVIDER` to `src/utils/config.py` (optional; default unchanged)
- Updated `src/data_fetchers/prices.py` to route to Stooq only when `PRICE_PROVIDER=stooq`; otherwise use existing Alpha Vantage path.
- Updated `.env.example` and README with Stooq usage.
- Added `tests/test_price_provider_routing.py` to assert:
  - When PRICE_PROVIDER is unset and ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY is missing, behavior is unchanged (RuntimeError)
  - When PRICE_PROVIDER=stooq, it routes to `fetch_price_history_stooq`

Validation:
- `pytest -q` (8 passed)

Git:
- Changes committed and pushed to origin/main.
close_reason: Added PRICE_PROVIDER config + routing to Stooq with docs/tests; validated and pushed.

title: Implement SEC companyfacts parsing into fundamentals payload
description: Fetch and parse SEC companyfacts JSON into a minimal fundamentals payload compatible with `fundamentals_summary`.
acceptance_criteria:
- Given a CIK, fetch companyfacts (cached) and extract a small set of metrics.
- Returns dict payload that can be passed through `fundamentals_summary` without exceptions.
- Unit tests cover parsing using fixture JSON.

title: Add portfolio tracking functionality
description: Allow users to create and track multiple stock portfolios with performance metrics and aggregate analysis.

title: Reorganize Streamlit UI with tab-based layout
description: Transform the linear stock analyzer UI into a modern tab-based interface with dedicated sections for Technical Analysis, Fundamental Analysis, Charts, AI Insights, and News & Catalysts. Added color-coding for positive/negative values, tooltips for financial metrics, improved visual hierarchy, and better organization of all metrics.
close_reason: Completed: Successfully reorganized Streamlit UI with 5 tabs (Technical Analysis, Fundamental Analysis, Charts, AI Insights, News & Catalysts). Added color-coding for trends and returns, tooltips for metrics, improved visual hierarchy with dividers and containers, and enhanced 52-week range visualization with progress bar.

title: Improve test coverage for data fetchers
description: Add unit tests with mocked API responses for all data fetcher modules (prices, fundamentals, news, events).

title: Implement SEC ticker->CIK mapping + cached fetch
description: Add a reusable helper to resolve ticker to CIK with caching and required User-Agent.
acceptance_criteria:
- Helper resolves ticker->CIK and caches results.
- Uses a configurable SEC User-Agent string.
- Unit tests cover mapping parsing and caching behavior (mocked HTTP).

title: Remove SSL verification bypass for production
description: Replace httpx.Client(verify=False) in orchestrator.py with proper SSL certificate handling. Current workaround is only for development.
close_reason: Completed: Removed httpx.Client(verify=False) from orchestrator.py. Now using proper SSL verification with OpenAI SDK defaults. Added guidance comments for fixing SSL issues at system level. Updated CLAUDE.md documentation.

title: Add Stooq as optional EOD price source (no API key)
description: Add a new, free, no-key EOD price data source (Stooq) as an optional backend for `fetch_price_history`, while keeping the current Alpha Vantage behavior as the default to avoid breaking existing setups.
design:
- Add provider switch via env var `PRICE_PROVIDER` with allowed values: `alpha_vantage` (default), `stooq`.
- Default behavior MUST remain unchanged: if `PRICE_PROVIDER` is unset, continue using the current Alpha Vantage logic (and fail the same way it fails today if the key is missing).
- Implement Stooq backend in a separate module (e.g., `src/data_fetchers/prices_stooq.py`) and route from `src/data_fetchers/prices.py`.
- Normalize output to the existing schema (`date` index + `open/high/low/close/volume` columns where available).
- Add small unit tests using mocked HTTP responses (no network in tests).
acceptance_criteria:
- With `PRICE_PROVIDER=stooq`, `fetch_price_history('AAPL')` returns a DataFrame compatible with the existing technical analysis pipeline.
- With `PRICE_PROVIDER` unset, behavior remains identical to current (Alpha Vantage path unchanged).
- Errors from Stooq (bad ticker, empty response) are handled gracefully (returns empty DataFrame or raises a clear exception consistent with existing patterns).
- Tests cover provider routing + Stooq CSV parsing.
- Docs update: `.env.example` and README mention `PRICE_PROVIDER`.

title: Add price alerts and notification system
description: Allow users to set price alerts (above/below thresholds) and RSI alerts (overbought/oversold). Display alert indicators in UI when conditions are met. Store alerts in session state.
design: Add 'Set Alert' button in Overview. Modal to configure price/RSI thresholds. Visual indicators (badges) when alerts trigger. List of active alerts in sidebar.

title: Implement database storage for historical analyses
description: Use src/storage/db.py to store analysis results and track stock performance over time. Enable historical comparison and backtesting.

title: Add comprehensive unit tests for technical analysis
description: Write tests for RSI, MACD, EMA, volatility, and drawdown calculations in src/analysis/technicals.py
